timeline.bodyText: Please drop type for now, we can add later if someone will prefer non-HTTP
timeline.author: sberyozkin
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -467,6 +483,59 @@ public void setPrincipalClaim(String principalClaim) { } } + @ConfigGroup + public static class Proxy { + + /** + * The host (name or IP address) of the Proxy.
+ * Note: If OIDC adapter needs to use a Proxy to talk with OIDC server (Provider), + * then at least both "host" and "port" items must be configured to enable the usage of a Proxy. + */ + @ConfigItem + public Optional host = Optional.empty(); + + /** + * The port number of the Proxy. + */ + @ConfigItem + public Optional port = Optional.empty(); + + /** + * The username, if Proxy needs authentication. + */ + @ConfigItem + public Optional username = Optional.empty(); + + /** + * The password, if Proxy needs authentication. + */ + @ConfigItem + public Optional password = Optional.empty(); + + /** + * The proxy type. Default value is "HTTP".
+ * Allowed values (as defined in {@link io.vertx.core.net.ProxyType}) are: "HTTP", "SOCKS4", and "SOCKS5". + */ + @ConfigItem(defaultValue = "HTTP") + public Optional type = Optional.empty();

timeline.bodyText: Please move this to the internal OidcRecorder helper, we don't really put Vertx dependencies in OidcTenantConfig; instead please add getters/setters (as is done elsewhere), setters would help to TenantConfigResolver multi-tenancy implementations which create OidcTenantConfig :-)

timeline.bodyText: You can set the defaultValue of 80 here instead
timeline.author: gastaldi
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -467,6 +477,37 @@ public void setPrincipalClaim(String principalClaim) { } } + @ConfigGroup + public static class Proxy { + + /** + * The host (name or IP address) of the Proxy.
+ * Note: If OIDC adapter needs to use a Proxy to talk with OIDC server (Provider), + * then at least both "host" and "port" items must be configured to enable the usage of a Proxy. + */ + @ConfigItem + public Optional host = Optional.empty(); + + /** + * The port number of the Proxy. + */ + @ConfigItem

timeline.bodyText: Not being picky here, but you can also use OptionalInt.of(80) for cases where config injection is not available 😉
timeline.author: gastaldi

replies.bodyText: Or maybe replace the OptionalInt with an int, since we're assuming a default value now
replies.author: gastaldi

replies.bodyText: Can we clarify it here on the conversation below, please?
replies.author: dxps

timeline.bodyText: port is no longer required now as it assumes 80 as the default value
timeline.author: gastaldi

replies.bodyText:
You're right! Again! 😊  Sorry, forgot about it.
I was in a hurry to make sure this small scope is covered.
replies.author: dxps

timeline.bodyText: Ah sorry, I didn't mean to remove the defaultValue from @configitem. I was just suggesting to make it non-injection-environments friendly :)
timeline.author: gastaldi

replies.bodyText:
Np, but you lost me. Can you provide the concrete expectiation, please?
Sorry that I keep coming with non standard things in the code.
But eventually, after this small journey I will definitely want to contribute later to this wonderful project.

replies.bodyText: Yes, it should work, but you need to add the defaultValue attribute in @ConfigItem AFAIK, as I showed in #8120 (comment)
